title: High Social Contributions
description: In 2023, South Korea's social contributions reached 195,955,725,484,390 LCU, indicating a robust social welfare system.

title: Strong Revenue Generation
description: South Korea generated 658,831,362,225,453 LCU in revenue excluding grants in 2023, showcasing its strong fiscal capacity.

title: Significant Tax Revenue
description: In 2023, South Korea collected 351,646,677,140,000 LCU in tax revenue, reflecting effective tax policies.

title: High Taxes on Income and Profits
description: Taxes on income, profits, and capital gains amounted to 200,955,688,179,885 LCU in 2023, indicating a strong tax base.

title: Extensive Goods and Services Expenditure
description: South Korea spent 85,193,470,173,742 LCU on goods and services in 2023, highlighting significant public investment.

title: High Total Expenditure
description: The total government expenditure in 2023 was 682,200,777,504,349 LCU, reflecting substantial public sector involvement.

title: Large Subsidies and Transfers
description: In 2023, subsidies and other transfers amounted to 467,328,215,967,432 LCU, supporting various sectors and demographics.

title: Robust Private Sector Investment
description: The gross fixed capital formation in the private sector was 607,369,100,000,000 LCU in 2023, indicating strong private investment.

title: Positive Net Primary Income
description: South Korea's net primary income from abroad was 41,663,400,000,000 LCU in 2023, reflecting a positive balance of payments.

title: Abundant Hospital Beds
description: With 12.75 hospital beds per 1,000 people in 2021, South Korea ensures extensive healthcare infrastructure.

title: High Female Suicide Mortality Rate
description: The female suicide mortality rate was 16.94 per 100,000 in 2021, indicating a significant mental health challenge.

title: Aging Female Population
description: In 2023, 8.23% of the female population was aged 60-64, highlighting an aging demographic trend.

title: Lowest Mortality from Non-Communicable Diseases
description: In 2021, South Korea had one of the lowest mortality rates from cardiovascular diseases, cancer, diabetes, or chronic respiratory diseases, with a rate of 6.9% for the general population and 4.3% for females.

title: High Literacy Rates Among Primary School Pupils
description: As of 2019, only 0.8% of pupils in South Korea were below the minimum reading proficiency at the end of primary school, indicating strong literacy rates among young students.

title: Low Prevalence of Child Malnutrition
description: In 2020, South Korea reported minimal rates of underweight, stunting, and wasting among children under 5, with rates as low as 0.2% for both males and females.

title: Low Young Age Dependency Ratio
description: The young age dependency ratio in South Korea was 15.5% in 2023, one of the lowest globally, indicating a smaller proportion of young dependents relative to the working-age population.

title: Negative Net Secondary Income
description: In 2023, South Korea experienced a significant negative net secondary income, with net current transfers from abroad amounting to -4,894,500,000,000 LCU.

title: Low Population of Young Children
description: In 2023, the percentage of the population aged 0-4 was among the lowest globally, with 2.5% for females and 2.7% for males, reflecting a declining birth rate.
